patient.symptoms:
I’ve been feeling unwell for the past 4 days. The main symptoms I’m experiencing are:

Persistent cough, producing yellow-green mucus

Shortness of breath, especially when walking or lying down

Sharp chest pain that worsens when I breathe deeply or cough

High fever (around 39.5°C) with chills and sweating

Fatigue and weakness, making it difficult to carry out daily tasks

Loss of appetite and slight confusion at times

The symptoms came on gradually but have worsened, especially the breathing difficulties. I've taken paracetamol for the fever, but it provides only temporary relief.
patient.mental_health:
I’ve been struggling mentally for the past several weeks. The main symptoms I’m experiencing are:

Persistent low mood — I feel sad or numb most of the day, nearly every day

Loss of interest in activities I used to enjoy — nothing feels rewarding anymore

Fatigue and low energy — even small tasks feel overwhelming

Disturbed sleep — I either sleep too much or wake up multiple times at night

Difficulty concentrating — my mind feels foggy, and I can’t focus on work or conversations

Feelings of worthlessness and guilt — even when I haven’t done anything wrong

Changes in appetite — sometimes I don’t feel like eating at all, other times I eat too much

Thoughts of self-harm or hopelessness — I sometimes question whether things will ever improve

These symptoms are affecting my daily functioning, my relationships, and my ability to work or study. I haven’t told many people about this, but I know I need help.
patient.previous_tests:
Summary of Recent Lab Work and Imaging:

Complete Blood Count (CBC): Within normal limits; no signs of infection or anemia

Thyroid Function Tests (TSH, T3, T4): Normal — thyroid dysfunction ruled out as a cause of depressive symptoms

Vitamin D and B12 levels: Mild Vitamin D deficiency and borderline low Vitamin B12

Metabolic Panel: Normal glucose, liver, and kidney function

Brain MRI: No structural abnormalities or lesions detected

ai_diag.summary: A 17-year-old male presents with a 4-day history of persistent productive cough, shortness of breath, chest pain, high fever, fatigue, and confusion. His symptoms suggest a possible lower respiratory tract infection, and his recent mental health struggles indicate a need for further evaluation.
options: Major Depressive Disorder with somatic symptoms
Anxiety Disorder with panic attacks (due to shortness of breath)

selected_diagnoses: Major Depressive Disorder with somatic symptoms
Anxiety Disorder with panic attacks (due to shortness of breath)

ai_exam.summary: The patient presents with respiratory and psychological symptoms. The respiratory differential diagnoses include pneumonia, bronchitis, pleurisy, and pneumothorax. The psychological differential diagnoses include major depressive disorder, anxiety disorder with panic attacks, and somatization disorder.
